head.supplied: ¶ That £100.- .- ¶ ¶ be placed at the disposal of the Section for vegetable products ¶ Of theIntercolonialExhibition of Australasia, Melbourne, 1866-7. M was one of the Commissioners of the Exhibiti...

div.p: Unit 3, VPRS 927/P0000Correspondence relating to various exhibitions, Trustees of the Public Library, Museums and National Gallery of Victoria,Public Record Office, Victoria.

MS in M's handwriting, on a sheet with the Board of Agriculture's letterhead, annotated 'Memo | Dr Mueller'.There are further annotations, in a different hand:'[Passed] 50 on an amendment of Mr Bindon'and '£30 forGems'.The de facto addressee is John Knight, secretary to the Commissionfor the Intercolonial Exhibition.
That £100.- .-be placed at the disposal of the Section for vegetable products
Of theIntercolonialExhibition of Australasia, Melbourne, 1866-7. M was one of the Commissioners of the Exhibition.Item dated to 1866 since this was when the exhibits were being organized.Meetings of the Commission were heldin the officesof theBoard ofAgriculture and M may have prepared his memo during a meeting.
to obtain some material for exhibition that cannot be obtained without direct outlay &c to enable the section to arrange for the preparation of articles by chemical processes from vegetable substances.
